net.nicoulaj.maven.plugins.checksum.mojo

Class ArtifactsMojo

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.maven.plugin.AbstractMojo
      • net.nicoulaj.maven.plugins.checksum.mojo.ArtifactsMojo
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.apache.maven.plugin.ContextEnabled, org.apache.maven.plugin.Mojo

    @Mojo(name="artifacts",
      defaultPhase=VERIFY,
      requiresProject=true,
      inheritByDefault=false,
      threadSafe=true)
public class ArtifactsMojo
extends org.apache.maven.plugin.AbstractMojo
    Compute project artifacts checksum digests and store them in individual files and/or a summary file.
    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Julien Nicoulaud

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected List<String> algorithms
      The list of checksum algorithms used.
      protected boolean appendFilename
      Append the artifact filename in the generated checksum file.

      Should the checksums be attached as build artifacts.
      protected boolean csvSummary
      Indicates whether the build will store checksums to a single CSV summary file.
      protected String csvSummaryFile
      The name of the summary file created if the option is activated.
      protected String encoding
      Encoding to use for generated files.
      protected boolean failOnError
      Indicates whether the build will fail if there are errors.
      protected boolean includeRelativePath
      Indicates whether the build will output relative path information as well.

      Indicates whether the build will store checksums in separate files (one file per algorithm per artifact).

      The directory where output files will be stored.

      The mojo name.

      Indicates whether the build will print checksums in the build log.

      Sub path to use as the root of the relative path when including relative path in xml/csv files

      Indicates whether the build will store checksums to a single shasum summary file.

      The name of the summary file created if the option is activated.

        The mojo name.

      • individualFiles

        @Parameter(defaultValue="true")
protected boolean individualFiles
        Indicates whether the build will store checksums in separate files (one file per algorithm per artifact).
        Since:
        1.0

      • individualFilesOutputDirectory

        @Parameter
protected String individualFilesOutputDirectory
        The directory where output files will be stored. Leave unset to have each file next to the source file.
        Since:
        1.0

      • csvSummary

        @Parameter(defaultValue="false")
protected boolean csvSummary
        Indicates whether the build will store checksums to a single CSV summary file.
        Since:
        1.0

      • csvSummaryFile

        @Parameter(defaultValue="artifacts-checksums.csv")
protected String csvSummaryFile
        The name of the summary file created if the option is activated.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        csvSummary

        @Parameter(defaultValue="false")
protected boolean xmlSummary

      • appendFilename

        @Parameter(defaultValue="false")
protected boolean appendFilename
        Append the artifact filename in the generated checksum file. This parameter require the parameter individualFiles be equal to true.
        Since:
        1.4
        See Also:
        individualFiles

           required=true,

        Since:

      • projectHelper

        @Component
protected org.apache.maven.project.MavenProjectHelper projectHelper
        The Maven Project Helper. Used to attach checksums as build artifacts.
        Since:
        1.3

      • algorithms

        @Parameter
protected List<String> algorithms
        The list of checksum algorithms used.

        Default value is MD5 and SHA-1.

        Allowed values are Cksum, CRC32, BLAKE2B-160, BLAKE2B-256, BLAKE2B-384, BLAKE2B-512, GOST3411, GOST3411-2012-256, GOST3411-2012-512, KECCAK-224, KECCAK-256, KECCAK-288, KECCAK-384, KECCAK-512, MD2, MD4, MD5, RIPEMD128, RIPEMD160, RIPEMD256, RIPEMD320, SHA, SHA-1, SHA-224, SHA-256, SHA3-224, SHA3-256, SHA3-384, SHA3-512, SHA-384, SHA-512, SHA-512/224, SHA-512/256, SKEIN-1024-1024, SKEIN-1024-384, SKEIN-1024-512, SKEIN-256-128, SKEIN-256-160, SKEIN-256-224, SKEIN-256-256, SKEIN-512-128, SKEIN-512-160, SKEIN-512-224, SKEIN-512-256, SKEIN-512-384, SKEIN-512-512, SM3, TIGER and WHIRLPOOL.

        Use the following syntax: 

        <algorithms>
   <algorithm>MD5</algorithm>
   <algorithm>SHA-1</algorithm>
 </algorithms>
        Since:
        1.0

      • failOnError

        @Parameter(defaultValue="true")
protected boolean failOnError
        Indicates whether the build will fail if there are errors.
        Since:
        1.0

      • encoding

        @Parameter(property="encoding",
           defaultValue="${project.build.sourceEncoding}")
protected String encoding
        Encoding to use for generated files.
        Since:
        1.0

    • Method Detail

      • getFilesToProcess

        protected List<ChecksumFile> getFilesToProcess()
        Build the list of files from which digests should be generated.

        The list is composed of the project main and attached artifacts.

        Returns:
        the list of files that should be processed.
        See Also:
        hasValidFile(org.apache.maven.artifact.Artifact)

      • hasValidFile

        protected boolean hasValidFile(org.apache.maven.artifact.Artifact artifact)
        Decide whether the artifact file should be processed.

        Excludes the project POM file and any file outside the build directory, because this could lead to writing files on the user local repository for example.

        Parameters:
        artifact - the artifact to check.
        Returns:
        true if the artifact should be included in the files to process.
